messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/admin.php`, I found that `MediaLibraryController` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/media`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/admin.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `MediaLibraryController`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Files containing the MediaLibraryController handler implementations (paths relative to project root)

- app/Http/Controllers/Admin/MediaLibraryController.php

Explanation

- I searched the codebase for the controller class name and found the implementation at app/Http/Controllers/Admin/MediaLibraryController.php.
- That file contains the HTTP action handlers referenced by routes/admin.php for the resource 'media' (the resource is limited to: index, show, create, store, destroy). The controller implements these methods:
  - index(Request): returns the admin.media.index view with MediaLibrary::first()->media()->get().
  - show(Media $medium): returns the Media model instance.
  - create(Request): returns the admin.media.create view.
  - store(MediaLibraryRequest $request): accepts an uploaded image, determines a name, calls MediaLibrary::first()->addMedia(...)->usingName(...)->toMediaCollection(), then redirects to admin.media.index with success.
  - destroy(Media $medium): deletes the Media model instance and redirects to admin.media.index with success.
- I verified the file contents directly (app/Http/Controllers/Admin/MediaLibraryController.php) to confirm these implementations.
- Note: the controller depends on other classes (App\Http\Requests\Admin\MediaLibraryRequest, App\Models\Media, App\Models\MediaLibrary) but those are not handler implementations; the only file that implements the route handlers is the controller file listed above.
